meanings.definition: The process of representing a language in the Roman alphabet.
meanings.sent1: Romanisation helps people read languages in the Roman alphabet.
meanings.sent2: The romanisation of Japanese characters makes it easier for Westerners to understand.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how romanisation turns complex characters into simple letters.
meanings.sent4: The romanisation of Chinese feels like turning hieroglyphs into modern text.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of romanisation lies in its ability to bridge linguistic gaps.

meanings.definition: The act of transliterating a non-Roman script into Roman letters.
meanings.sent1: Romanisation is essential for converting foreign scripts into Roman letters.
meanings.sent2: The romanisation of Arabic script facilitates cross-cultural communication.
meanings.sent3: I chuckled at the idea of romanisation turning squiggles into familiar letters.
meanings.sent4: The romanisation of Sanskrit seems like unlocking a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The power of romanisation lies in its ability to make scripts universally readable.
